title: 170 Add two int arrays using a Threadpool
A Threadpool has a Queue of tasks, of which each will be executed on one these Threads.

inline_content.Text: A Threadpool has a Queue of tasks, of which each will be executed on one these Threads.

title: This example is purely illustrative. In practice, there won’t be any speedup by using threads for a task this small. A slowdown is likely, since the overheads of task creation and scheduling will swamp the time taken to run a task.

inline_content.Text: This example is purely illustrative. In practice, there won’t be any speedup by using threads for a task this small. A slowdown is likely, since the overheads of task creation and scheduling will swamp the time taken to run a task.

title: If you were using Java 7 and earlier, you would use anonymous classes instead of lambdas to implement the tasks.

inline_content.Text: If you were using Java 7 and earlier, you would use anonymous classes instead of lambdas to implement the tasks.
